page.title: 05FARMING l
page.content: BLAIR MAINS,which means home farm,is the largest in our block.It covers 248 acres or 100 hectares;70 acres for grazing 95 dairy cows and 60 calves;50 acres for hay and silage;70 acres barley for malting;20 acres wheat for animal feed;15 acres oats for muesli;10 acres potatoes for human food;6 acres turnips for cattle feed; 6 acres roads and woods. SOIL TYPES vary from sandy raised beach type to medium loam to silt.Also approx.35 acres of shallow moss over dry gravel base-impossible to grow anything in dry years,not so bad this wet spring,although farmers with better soil have been complaining.(It is interesting to note that the rainfall on this farm is only 27"a year_half that of the neighbouring farms.)
